intro: Hieracium faeroense, commonly known as the Faroe Hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Faroe Islands. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy areas and has hairy, leafy stems. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
